author: Lydia Beyoud, Amanda Albright
description: Representative Elise Stefanik called on the US Securities and Exchange Commission to investigate Harvard University’s recent bond sale, alleging the school may have withheld material information from investors about its standoff with the federal government.
title: Stefanik Asks SEC to Investigate Harvard Bond Offering

author: Nick Wadhams
description: The US Embassy in Jerusalem will remain closed for the next three days, the State Department said, as speculation grows that the Trump administration may be on the verge of joining Israel’s attack against Iran.
title: US Embassy in Jerusalem to Close for Three Days as Tensions Rise

author: Derek Decloet
description: Below are the key takeaways from our blog coverage of the Group of Seven leaders’ summit in Kananaskis, Canada. For more, click here for our TOPLive blog.
title: Key Takeaways From Summit of G-7 Leaders in Canada

author: Thomas Seal
description: Canada and India agreed to appoint new chief diplomats in a major step toward moving past a feud that last year saw them expel each other’s officials over accusations of transnational repression and crime.
title: Canada and India Agree to Name New Ambassadors After Expulsions

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: Viasat Inc. is the latest US communications company identified as a victim of the sweeping surveillance hack blamed on the Chinese government that emerged during last year’s presidential campaign, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Viasat Identified as Victim in Sweeping Phone Hack Tied to China

author: Stephanie Lai
description: President Donald Trump is extending for a third time the deadline for Chinese company ByteDance Ltd. to divest the American operations of TikTok, allowing the social media app to keep running in the US while negotiations proceed.
title: Trump Again Pushes TikTok Sale Deadline With 90-Day Extension

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: The US Senate passed stablecoin legislation setting up regulatory rules for cryptocurrencies pegged to the dollar, in a landmark win for the ascendant crypto industry and President Donald Trump.
title: Senate Passes Stablecoin Bill in Win for Crypto, Trump

author: Erik Wasson
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Erik Wasson looks at what’s ahead in the Senate for the GOP tax and spending bill. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Thune Has His Big Moment in Wrangling Tax Bill Through Senate

author: Courtney McBride, Anthony Capaccio
description: US President Donald Trump has a wide range of military assets in the Middle East and across the globe to bring to bear in a potential fight against Iran as he weighs one of the most momentous foreign policy decisions of his administration.
title: The Bombs the US Could Deploy If Trump Strikes Iran

author: Mackenzie Hawkins, Miaojung Lin, Yian Lee
description: Taiwan joined a yearslong US campaign to curtail China’s technological ascent when it blacklisted the country’s AI and chipmaking champions, an unprecedented step that may signal a resurgent effort to isolate its powerful neighbor’s semiconductor sector.
title: US-China Tech Fight Widens After Taiwan Blacklists Huawei

author: Manuela Tobias
description: Former President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner will carry out her six-year sentence for corruption under house arrest, a judge decided after Argentina’s top court upheld a previous ruling that also bars her from public office for life.
title: Argentine Court Sentences Kirchner to House Arrest, La Nacion Reports

author: Jarrell Dillard
description: The House-passed version of Republicans’ tax and spending bill would add $2.8 trillion to US deficits over the next decade, according to new estimates from the Congressional Budget Office that incorporate the broader impact the legislation would have on the economy and federal budget.
title: House Tax Bill Boosts Deficit $2.8 Trillion, CBO Analysis Shows

author: Patrick Howell O'Neill
description: A pro-Israel hacking group claimed responsibility on Tuesday for a disruptive cyberattack against a major Iranian bank, the latest development in the ongoing military conflict between the two countries.
title: Pro-Israel Hackers Say They Launched Cyberattack Against Iran

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: A Pentagon plan to slash staffing at its weapons testing office threatens the safety and effectiveness of every weapons program it oversees and “will cost service members’ lives and waste taxpayer dollars,” Senator Elizabeth Warren said.
title: Warren Slams Hegseth Decision to Slash Pentagon Weapons Testing Office

author: Akayla Gardner
description: President Donald Trump was set to meet his national security team in Washington on Tuesday to discuss the escalating Middle East conflict, fueling fresh speculation that the US is on the verge of joining Israel’s attack on Iran.
title: Trump to Meet Security Team After Demanding Iran’s ‘Surrender’

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: President Donald Trump’s continued use of California’s National Guard to respond to protests in Los Angeles faces fresh scrutiny on Tuesday in a high-stakes proceeding over the limits of his executive authority.
title: Trump’s Grip on Troops in LA Faces Test at Appeals Court Hearing

author: Nacha Cattan, Myles Miller
description: New York City Comptroller Brad Lander was arrested outside of immigration court in lower Manhattan.
title: NYC Mayoral Candidate Lander Arrested at Immigration Court

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court was asked for the first time to consider striking down President Donald Trump’s most sweeping tariffs, putting the justices in the middle of a high-stakes fight with worldwide economic implications.
title: Supreme Court Asked to Hear Challenge to Trump’s Global Tariffs

author: Eric Martin
description: Mexico’s President Claudia Sheinbaum expects to meet Donald Trump soon after their planned encounter was canceled when the US president departed early from a Group of Seven summit in Canada.
title: Sheinbaum Says There Will Be New Opportunity to Meet Trump Soon

author: Dana Khraiche, Youssef Diab
description: One of Israel’s most feared scenarios has long been that Iran would one day unleash an attack on the country in coordination with its powerful network of allied militant proxies.
title: Once-Mighty Hezbollah Stays Out of Israel’s War With Backer Iran

author: Lucy White, Ellen Milligan
description: The UK does not need to push out British Steel’s Chinese owners in order to cut a deal to reduce US tariffs on steel, Prime Minister Keir Starmer said.
title: Starmer Says US Not Targeting Steel Ownership in Trade Talks

author: David Herbling
description: Hooded motorcyclists armed with whips and clubs attacked crowds protesting alleged police violence in two of Kenya’s biggest cities, in events that left at least 23 people injured.
title: Bikers With Whips Rout Kenya Anti-Police Protesters; Dozens Hurt

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: The European Union proposed an array of measures aimed at lightening the regulatory load for defense investments as part of the bloc’s push to boost its arms industry.
title: EU Proposes Measures to Cut Red Tape for Defense Investment

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero
description: A discussion among Group of Seven leaders over dinner on Monday did little to move US President Donald Trump toward tougher sanctions on Russia, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: G-7 Leaders Fail to Convince Trump to Toughen Russia Stance

author: Alastair Marsh, Laura Noonan
description: Top officials from central banks and finance ministries were forced to call a timeout at a meeting of the world’s most powerful financial watchdog last week, amid clashes over the US stance on climate change.
title: US Draws Ire of France, Canada at Meeting of Finance Regulators

author: Erik Wasson, Alicia Diaz
description: Republican leaders are aiming for quick negotiations over needed changes to the newly unveiled Senate tax bill which lacks the votes to secure majorities in both chambers as written.
title: Tax Bill Lacks Votes as Senate Aims for Deals on SALT, Medicaid

author: Josh Wingrove, Stephanie Lai, Arsalan Shahla
description: Israel and the US are ratcheting up pressure on Iran, fueling fears that Washington may be preparing for a more direct intervention alongside its closest Middle East ally.
title: Trump Ups Pressure on Iran, Fueling Fears US Will Join Conflict

description: Signage at the G7 Media Centre during the Group of Seven (G-7) Leaders' Summit in Banff, Alberta, Canada, on June 15. Photographer: Gavin John/Bloomberg
title: Updates From G-7 Leaders’ Summit

author: John Ainger, Ewa Krukowska
description: The European Union’s proposed ban on all Russian gas by the end of 2027 sets the stage for heated debate, with some member states nervous it will boost energy prices and cost companies millions of euros in legal fees.
title: EU Proposal to Ban Russian Gas Set for Heated Negotiations

author: Philip Aldrick
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves has said any further rise to the UK’s budget for defense won’t come until the next parliament, raising questions about how the government will meet NATO spending commitments.
title: Reeves Says UK Won’t Lift Defense Budget Again This Parliament

author: Teresa Xie, Steven T. Dennis
description: Crypto companies are investing in Democrats as they seek to muscle an industry-friendly regulatory regime through Congress and ensure new laws persist after President Donald Trump leaves office.
title: Crypto Is Investing in Democrats to Advance Agenda in Congress

author: Krystof Chamonikolas
description: The Czech Republic’s top diplomat said his country is prepared to extend its program to deliver heavy ammunition to Ukraine into next year as Europe rushes to bolster support to Kyiv.
title: Ukraine Arms Supplies Can Stretch Into 2026, Czech Minister Says

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russia is watching Israel’s bombardment of Iran with mounting concern for the survival of a key ally, though the Kremlin recognizes it has few levers to influence the escalating conflict in the Middle East.
title: Russia Watches Israel-Iran Crisis With Few Tools to Intervene

author: Sofia Sorochinskaia
description: Russia’s postal service is resuming package delivery to North Korea for the first time since 2020 in another sign of deepening ties between the two heavily sanctioned countries.
title: Russian Post Resumes Parcel Delivery to North Korea as Ties Grow

author: James Mayger, Martin Ritchie
description: Western nations will take years to develop enough rare earth processing capacity to limit China’s dominance over the critical ingredients, according to industry veteran and former Molycorp Inc. boss Mark Smith.
title: Rare Earth Boss Sees ‘Long, Hard Process’ to Loosen China’s Grip

author: Max Ramsay, Andrea Palasciano
description: US military involvement in the spiraling conflict between Iran and Israel risks spreading throughout the Middle East, the European Union’s top diplomat warned on Tuesday.
title: EU Top Envoy Warns of Broader Conflict If US Is Involved in Iran

author: Martin Z Braun
description: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic Socialist polling second in New York City’s Democratic mayoral primary, is proposing to take on tens of billions of debt to finance affordable housing construction in the largest US city.
title: NYC Mayoral Candidate Mamdani Seeks $70 Billion of Debt to Fund Affordable Housing

author: Golnar Motevalli
description: In launching the biggest military assault on Iran since that country’s war with Iraq in the 1980s, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu had more on his mind than the destruction of the Islamic Republic’s nuclear program.
title: All the Ways Iran’s Regime Keeps a Tight Grip on Power

author: Kamran Haider, Michal Kubala
description: Pakistan’s military said its army chief is in the US on an official visit, just weeks after President Donald Trump said he had brokered a ceasefire between Islamabad and New Delhi following intense clashes.
title: Pakistan’s Army Chief Makes First US Trip After India Clashes

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: The US president’s early departure highlighted his contempt for the forum, once a place where like-minded allies would discuss international crises
title: Trump’s Snub to G-7 Bodes Ill for NATO Summit

author: Alicia Diaz
description: US businesses and wealthy universities scored major wins in the Senate Republicans’ version of President Donald Trump’s tax bill, while low-income Americans and clean energy providers are poised to be hit the hardest.
title: Harvard Wins Reprieve, SALT Stalls: Tax Bill Winners and Losers

author: Selcan Hacaoglu, Firat Kozok
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan ordered officials to increase the production of medium and long-range missiles in light of the Israel-Iran conflict, an acceleration of plans to develop a strong home-grown industry.
title: Turkey Accelerates Missile Production Amid Fears of Wider War

author: Soo-Hyang Choi, Hyonhee Shin
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin’s top security aide Sergei Shoigu made his third visit to North Korea in as many months according to Tass, in a sign of Moscow’s deepening embrace of North Korea.
title: Putin’s Aide Shoigu Visits Pyongyang Again on ‘Special Mission’

author: Andrew Rosati, Meg Lopes
description: La ciudad, ubicada en el corazón agrícola de Brasil, se está convirtiendo en un nuevo destino a medida que EE.UU. da la espalda a quienes huyen de la isla.
title: El éxodo cubano toma un nuevo rumbo: adiós Miami, hola Curitiba

author: Andrew Rosati, Meg Lopes
description: Curitiba, the capital of a wealthy agricultural state, is becoming a new favored destination as the US turns its back on those fleeing the communist island
title: Cubans Shut Out by Trump Are Ditching Miami for Brazil’s Deep South

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: South Korea’s President Lee Jae-myung hopes to clinch a trade agreement with the US ahead of a looming July deadline, according to his nominee for prime minister, after a high-stakes meeting with Donald Trump was called off at the last minute.
title: South Korea’s Lee Wants Trade Deal with US Before July Deadline

author: James Mayger, Qianwei Zhang
description: China suggested the US use its influence with Israel to stop the conflict with Iran from spilling over, a sign Beijing is becoming increasingly concerned about the stability of a region it relies on for energy supplies.
title: China Suggests US Should Help Ease Tensions Between Israel, Iran

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi had no opportunity to push for a US trade deal with Donald Trump after the American president left the Group of Seven leaders’ summit early, a potential setback for New Delhi as recent tariff negotiations hit hurdles.
title: Modi Misses Chance to Push for US Trade Deal as Trump Leaves G-7

author: Josh Xiao, Fran Wang
description: China is testing the limits of what its consumer stimulus can accomplish by subsidizing purchases of select goods, fueling a shopping spree that boosted retail sales growth to the strongest in more than a year but threatening to overwhelm authorities even in the richest regions.
title: China’s Consumer Rush for Subsidies Overloads Stimulus Program

author: Kamran Haider, Shruti Srivastava
description: Pakistan and US officials held high-level tariff talks on Monday and aim to finalize a trade agreement at the earliest, Islamabad said in a statement, as the South Asian nation pushes for relief from retaliatory duties imposed by President Donald Trump.
title: Pakistan, US Target Early Trade Deal After High-Level Discussion

author: Josh Wingrove, Stephanie Lai, Arsalan Shahla
description: US President Donald Trump left the Group of Seven leaders meeting in Canada early to deal with the Israel-Iran conflict, but played down the chances of a ceasefire.
title: Trump Plays Down Iran-Israel Ceasefire as He Leaves G-7 Early

author: Sotiris Nikas
description: Greece’s Hellenic Defense systems and Czechoslovak Group AS have agreed to jointly produce ammunition, in a bid to bolster Europe’s weapons capabilities.
title: Greece Steps Up Defense Push With Deal for Ammunition Production

author: Leonard Kehnscherper
description: Rachel Reeves is considering reversing a decision to charge inheritance tax on the overseas assets of non-doms, according to the Financial Times.
title: Reeves Weighs Reversing Non-Dom Inheritance Tax Changes, FT Says

author: Derek Wallbank
description: US President Donald Trump said his early departure from the Group of Seven leaders meeting in Canada has “nothing to do” with working on a ceasefire between Israel and Iran, instead saying his reason is “much bigger than that.”
title: Trump Says G-7 Exit for ‘Much Bigger’ Reason Than Ceasefire

author: Josh Xiao, James Mayger
description: The European Union is refusing to hold an economic meeting with China due to a lack of progress on trade disputes, the Financial Times reports, underscoring tensions between the two sides even as Beijing tries to warm ties.
title: EU Refused Meeting With China on Lack of Trade Progress, FT Says

author: Kateryna Chursina
description: Russian air strikes killed at least 14 people in Kyiv as multiple locations in the Ukrainian capital were hit by drones and missiles or struck by intercepted projectiles.
title: Russian Air Strikes Pound Kyiv as Trump Goes Slow on Sanctions

author: Josh Wingrove, Alberto Nardelli
description: President Donald Trump’s hasty exit from the Group of Seven conference in Canada deepened questions about his promise to bring peace to an increasingly violent world and added fresh evidence of his skepticism toward the institutions that have long underpinned US diplomacy.
title: Trump Leaves G-7 Summit Early in Fresh Dismissal of Global Order

author: Matthew Brooker
description: The Labour government’s plan to boost spending on affordable homes has the potential to pay for itself in wider economic benefits.
title: Britain's Housing Splurge Is Long Overdue

author: Nick Wadhams
description: The Group of Seven leaders pushed for a de-escalation in the Middle East but didn’t call for an immediate end to the conflict between Israel and Iran in a statement that also affirmed Israel’s right to defend itself.
title: G-7 Leaders Seek ‘Resolution of the Iranian Crisis’ in Statement

author: Michael Heath
description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese’s first in-person meeting with Donald Trump was canceled after the president decided to leave a Group of Seven summit early to focus on the conflict between Israel and Iran.
title: Australian PM’s Meeting With Trump Scrapped After G-7 Departure

author: Josh Xiao
description: China warned the Iran-Israel conflict may spread wider instability in the Middle East, with Foreign Minister Wang Yi reaching out to both countries as their days-old conflict shows no end in sight.
title: China Warns Iran-Israel Conflict May Spiral, Calls for Peace

author: Rachel Metz
description: OpenAI has won a $200 million contract for a pilot program aimed at helping the US Defense Department determine how it could use artificial intelligence for a range of administrative and security tasks.
title: OpenAI Snags $200 Million Contract With US Defense Department

author: Simone Iglesias, Martha Viotti Beck
description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s efforts to shore up Brazil’s budget are on the brink of another setback after Congress advanced a push to block tax increases on some financial transactions from taking effect.
title: Brazil Congress Threatens to Deal Fresh Blow to Lula Fiscal Plan

author: Emily Birnbaum, Erik Wasson
description: Senate Republicans plan to modify President Donald Trump’s massive fiscal package to lower maximum deductions for state and local taxes and limit the impact of a “revenge” tax on foreign investors.
title: What’s New in the Senate Version of Trump’s Tax and Spending Bill
